00060 /* 10/29/02 REK Adding config.h */
00061 #include <config.h>
00062 
00063 #include <stdio.h>
00064 #ifndef __WIN32__
00065 #include <unistd.h>
00066 #include <sys/wait.h>
00067 #else
00068 #include <process.h>
00069 #endif
00070 #include <library/execute.h>
00071 #include <library/c_basic.h>
00072 
00073 int error_code = 0;
00074 static int dryrun = 0;
00075 static int verbose = 0;
00076 
00077 /*
00078  *      Initialize a command buffer.
00079  */
00080 int
00081 InitArgv (Argv argv)
00082 {
00083   argv->argc = 0;
00084   argv->argv[0] = 0;
00085   return 0;
00086 }
00087 /*
00088  *      Add an argument to a command.
00089  *      Return -1 if the command line is too long.
00090  *      Otherwise, returns the current argument count.
00091  */
00092 int
00093 AddArgument (Argv argv, char *str)
00094 {
00095   char line[512];
00096   int i;
00097   for (i = 0; i < 512; i++)
00098     {
00099       if ((str[i] == ' ') || (str[i] == '\0'))
00100         break;
00101       line[i] = str[i];
00102     }
00103   line[i] = '\0';
00104   if (argv->argc >= (MAX_ARGC - 1))
00105     return -1;
00106   argv->argv[argv->argc] = C_findstr (line);
00107   argv->argc += 1;
00108   argv->argv[argv->argc] = 0;
00109   return argv->argc;
00110 }
00111 /*
00112  *      Change the Nth argument. (0<N)
00113  */
00114 int
00115 ChangeArgument (Argv argv, int N, char *str)
00116 {
00117   char line[512];
00118   int i;
00119   for (i = 0; i < 512; i++)
00120     {
00121       if ((str[i] == ' ') || (str[i] == '\0'))
00122         break;
00123       line[i] = str[i];
00124     }
00125   line[i] = '\0';
00126   if ((N < 1) || (N >= argv->argc))
00127     return -1;
00128   argv->argv[N - 1] = C_findstr (line);
00129   return N;
00130 }
00131 /*
00132  *      Enable/disable the execution system.
00133  */
00134 int
00135 DebugExecute (int flag)
00136 {
00137   if (flag < 0)
00138     {
00139       dryrun = 1;
00140       verbose = 0;
00141     }
00142   else if (flag == 0)
00143     {
00144       dryrun = 0;
00145       verbose = 0;
00146     }
00147   else
00148     {
00149       dryrun = 0;
00150       verbose = 1;
00151     }
00152   return 0;
00153 }
00154 /*
00155  *      Execute a command and returns the status.
00156  */
00157 int
00158 Execute (Argv argv)
00159 {
00160 #ifndef __WIN32__
00161 
00162 #if defined(i386) || defined(_SOLARIS_SOURCE)
00163   int status;
00164 #else
00165   union wait status;
00166 #endif
00167 #endif
00168   if (dryrun)
00169     {
00170       int i;
00171       printf ("execute :");
00172       for (i = 0; i < argv->argc; i++)
00173         {
00174           printf (" %s", argv->argv[i]);
00175         }
00176       printf ("\n");
00177       return 0;
00178     }
00179   if (verbose)
00180     {
00181       int i;
00182       printf ("execute :");
00183       for (i = 0; i < argv->argc; i++)
00184         {
00185           printf (" %s", argv->argv[i]);
00186         }
00187       printf ("\n");
00188     }
00189 
00190 #ifndef __WIN32__
00191   if (vfork () == 0)
00192     execvp (argv->argv[0], argv->argv);
00193   wait ((int *) &status);
00194 
00195 #if defined(i386) || defined(_SOLARIS_SOURCE)
00196   if (WCOREDUMP (status))
00197     {                           /* core dump */
00198       error_code = 0;
00199       return CORE_DUMP;
00200     }
00201   else if (WTERMSIG (status))
00202     {                           /* program stops due to signal */
00203       error_code = WTERMSIG (status);
00204       return TERM_SIG;
00205     }
00206   else if (WEXITSTATUS (status) & 0x80)
00207     {                           /* program returns negative */
00208       error_code = 0;
00209       return EXIT_NEGATIVE;
00210     }
00211   else
00212     {                           /* normal return */
00213       error_code = 0;
00214       return WEXITSTATUS (status);
00215     }
00216 #else
00217   if (status.w_coredump)
00218     {                           /* core dump */
00219       error_code = 0;
00220       return CORE_DUMP;
00221     }
00222   else if (status.w_termsig != 0)
00223     {                           /* program stops due to signal */
00224       error_code = status.w_termsig;
00225       return TERM_SIG;
00226     }
00227   else if (status.w_retcode & 0x80)
00228     {                           /* program returns negative */
00229       error_code = 0;
00230       return EXIT_NEGATIVE;
00231     }
00232   else
00233     {                           /* normal return */
00234       error_code = 0;
00235       return status.w_retcode;
00236     }
00237 #endif
00238 
00239 #else /* __WIN32__ */
00240   /* ADA 5/29/96: Win95/NT does have equvivalent forms for fork()/wait(), but
00241      the infra-structure is so different that we rather use the returned
00242      value just for now */
00243 
00244   return execvp (argv->argv[0], argv->argv);
00245 
00246 #endif
00247 
00248 }
